docs.snippet: Football players at Northwestern University on Friday became the first U.S. student athletes to cast ballots in an election to decide whether to unionize....
docs.lead_paragraph: Football players at Northwestern University on Friday became the first U.S. student athletes to cast ballots in an election to decide whether to unionize.

headline.main: Football Players Are First College Athletes to Vote on Union
headline.print_headline: Football Players Are First College Athletes to Vote on Union

docs.snippet: As expected, the National Labor Relations Board said it will examine the question of whether scholarship athletes should be considered university employees....
docs.lead_paragraph: As expected, the National Labor Relations Board said it will examine the question of whether scholarship athletes should be considered university employees.
docs.abstract: National Labor Relations Board in Washington announces that it will review landmark decision that held that Northwestern University’s scholarship football players should be considered employees; decision to consider the case, which was expected and could have tremendous implications for college sports, comes on the eve of a vote by the Northwestern football team on whether to certify a players’ union.

headline.main: Labor Board to Review Northwestern Football Case
headline.print_headline: N.L.R.B. to Review the Status of Athletes

byline.original: By BEN STRAUSS and STEVE EDER

docs.snippet: A key front in the effort to reform the N.C.A.A. is medical coverage for college athletes, some of whom have become burdened with costs to treat their injuries....
docs.lead_paragraph: A key front in the effort to reform the N.C.A.A. is medical coverage for college athletes, some of whom have become burdened with costs to treat their injuries.
docs.abstract: Medical care for injured athletes has emerged as a key front in sprawling battle to reform the NCAA; hope is to ensure that current and former athletes never pay out of pocket for sports injuries; under current NCAA rules, players can still lose their scholarships after being hurt, often pay for their own insurance and are generally responsible for long-term health care for injuries sustained on the playing field.

headline.main: A Fight to Keep College Athletes From the Pain of Injury Costs
headline.print_headline: A Fight to Save College Athletes From the Ordeal of Injury Costs
